title: Project Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Guelph
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward nothing extremely difficult and only 1 stage during the interview process. However, interviews at universities are panel interviews to remove bias. So I had three people interview me (it's more common to have two but in some cases, three people run an interview depending on the job and department). Interviews can vary a lot depending on the department you apply for and the salary band.
Interview Questions: What kind of experience do you have building relations across departments and how do you maintain them?

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Guelph
Interview Descriptions: It’s mostly behavioural basis and they ask simple questions through zoom. Just need to dress up formal and show up to the interview to secure the job. Make sure to ask questions at the end about the day to day activities to show them you are interested.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and a situation when you had to deal with a difficult client.

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Guelph (Guelph, ON) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: The process was lengthy and the rejection email was roughly templated and unclear. While I wasn't outright turned down for a lack of compatibility with the role, they instead stated that they need to repost the job due to "the new year", and no invitation to re-apply - I think anyone would rather just hear that they're not a good fit. I expected more from one of Canada's top employers.
Interview Questions: Many of our practises are highly confidential. Have you ever been in a position to have to withhold confidential information?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Guelph
Interview Descriptions: Contacted for first interview and set up a time. It was a pre-screening by phone. Second interview was a zoom call interview with four stakeholders and was given an assignment. Never heard back one way or the other.
Interview Questions: what experience do you have that would be relevant to the job

title: Reservation Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Guelph (University of Guelph, ON) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Excellent experience with two Managers, very friendly and asked appropriate questions, they made you feel very comfortable. 
They set a time and stuck to it, called prior, sent a follow-up email and made sure to accommodate if necessary.
Interview Questions: Typical questions related to job skills

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Guelph
Interview Descriptions: Emailed expression of interest and resume/cv, met in person at their office to discuss the opportunity, and topics of the interview included my background, interests and next steps. Interview lasted less than 30 minutes and was split with myself talking for half and them talking for half.
Interview Questions:
What is your relevant experience? 
Does this interest you?

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Guelph (Toronto, ON) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: There were 3 interviewer. they were friendly except one of them. It took so long , approximately more than 1 hour. They bombard me with various questions. Questions were safety related, behavioral and skill related or technical.
Interview Questions: What hazard you can think of in a histology lab?

title: Senior Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Guelph
Interview Descriptions:
A lot of questions regarding Computer science, networks,  Personal skills and future plan.
There was also a technical test in Perl and R.
The committee is nice even though 6 persons were there
Interview Questions: Did you manage a team?

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Guelph
Interview Descriptions: It was done by a profesdpr an recorded for HR, generally was good and reasonable, actually it was for a 3 months contract for a specific project and i didnt expect more complexity on that
Interview Questions: Tell about yourself and your expectation and salary

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Guelph in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly interviewers, made sure that I felt at ease! It felt less like an interview and more like a conversation. Standard interview questions (tell us about yourself, why are you applying for this job etc) and a couple basic behavioural questions.
Interview Questions: Describe one situation where you were working in a team and you ran into a conflict?

title: Student Tour Guide Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Guelph
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward interview, asking questions about your degree, experiences on campus and knowledge of resources. Also go into depth about your plans and how long you're staying at the university, be passionate!
Interview Questions: Experience in a public-speaking role

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Guelph in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: Difficult interview, nice people! Had to prepare a presentation & the interview was an hour and a half long. The people were super friendly and accommodating. But overall learned a lot!
Interview Questions: Please tell us about the background and experience you’d bring to this position, specifically as related to the competencies that are outlined in the job posting. How do you think that experience has prepared you for this job?

title: Information Technology Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Guelph
Interview Descriptions: Very bad experience !Its normal not to have a successful profile, and it may be normal-although still not good- not to reply to each unsuccessful  candidate during the  initial screening of all applications for any role, yet to be shortlisted among few and already proceed with 2 rounds of interview then the recruitment consultant completely ignore you ..this shows a huge lack of respect and show how unprofessional their recruitment consultants are ! If you are that  lazy  not to reply to 2 or 3 who provided their time to reach this advanced stage and ignore their follow up mail-even though it was sent as a follow up for their  proactive promise  to get back to you with a status @ a certain time - , then you are simply framing the fact that such candidates were lucky that they didn't  work in such environment !Again this is not about replying to all applications in initial screening ,this is about the few who reached final stages of  the selection process and already had face-to-face interview with the  hiring committee !
Interview Questions: Just Generic Questions regarding previous situation of Conflict ,Complexity ,projects and how you reacted in them .

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Guelph in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: online process, two interviews. Somewhat odd questions, wondering what they are looking for as it seems to be a position not as a finance manager more of a data analyst.
Interview Questions: We have old systems and no budget, do you really want to work here

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant (Computer Science) Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Guelph
Interview Descriptions:
There's no interview for UTA positions.
After you apply for a UTA position, they'll check over the different applications, and will directly send offers to chosen candidates with a few days to respond.
After you accept an offer, nothing will happen for a month or so until the start of the semester, at which point you'll need to sign some paperwork and your supervisor will get in contact with you.
Interview Questions: There are no questions asked

title: Cluster Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Guelph (Guelph, ON) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: 5 simple what if (situational) questions spanning about 20 mins on Microsoft Teams. use the Star approach and you should be fine. Just stay professional and honest and you will do great!
Interview Questions: What was a time you had to tell someone something difficult and what was the outcome?

title: Writing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Guelph (Guelph, ON) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was long and exhausting, but that was their strength. The interview panel was eager to learn about my background and see my suitability from my perspective. The whole process, including a job talk and interview, took over four hours. There were short breaks as well, which were considerate.
Interview Questions: How has your background prepared you for this position

title: Social Media Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Guelph (Guelph, ON) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: Long interview, about an hour and a half. It was with a panel of four people over zoom. They were all lovely, very kind and knowledgeable. They asked about 10 questions.
Interview Questions: How do you think tone of voice changes, depending on the platform? (ie. Facebook, Instagram, etc.)

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Guelph
Interview Descriptions: There is no interview required to apply for the GTA Graduate Teaching Assistant in the university of Guelph. You can just apply online directly and then choose your preference of the courses that you would like to be a TA.
Interview Questions: What is your preference of the courses that you would like to be a TA

title: Junior Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Guelph (Guelph, ON) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied, was given opportunity for interview, went in, there were 2 people interviewing me/ They asked a few personality and experience questions, and I received a call the following day.
Interview Questions: What was a time where you worked with a difficult customer and how did you handle it?

title: Marketing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Guelph (Guelph, ON) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Met with 3 or 4 people from the team, all were friendly. University interviews in general are hard because there's essentially a "score sheet" and you have to say the right things to be hired (instead of based on experience, merit, or anything else logical). There were a few questions, mostly situational-based ("describe a time you worked in a team and had trouble making a decision" etc.). Some of the questions were a long paragraph and had multiple mini questions in them - don't be afraid to ask them to repeat it or break down the questions one at a time. At the end there was a writing component to write a news story/post based on information they give you.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a newsletter email was sent out with incorrect information?

title: Student Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Guelph in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: You have to be admitted into the work-study program and apply there. Once an application was submitted, I was invited to interview within around a week and was offered the position on the spot after a short interview.
Interview Questions: Q: Tell me about yourself Q: Why do you want to work at the library? Q: What is good customer service to you?

title: Muscle Simulator Evaluation and Tutorial Creation Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Guelph (Guelph, ON) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was given a room number of a building that I was able to easily find with a quick google search and went to the office of the professor that I was going to be hired by for the interview. We talked about why I was interested in the position and how I might be fit for the position.
Interview Questions: What about this position interests you?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Guelph (Guelph, ON) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very good. Walked through research. Asked questions. Walked through scenarios and questions about myself. Professional and straight to the point. Then after discussed school, life etc. It was very good.
Interview Questions: If you are struggling with understanding a concept, at what point do you try and understand it yourself vs asking for help.

title: SPARK Communicator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Guelph in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Laid back, easy nothing to be worried about and questions are not difficult 
Super nice and easy to talk to and get along with overall super good experience good review
Interview Questions: What are your strengths

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Guelph (Guelph, ON) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview was done via Skype where I had to communicate with the principal supervisor. It started with a few pleasantries just to ease the atmosphere and then the interview began.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself  and why you are interested in this position

title: Workshop Facilitator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Guelph in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Overall, loved working here although it was contract so no benefits. I was given a lot of guidance and a lot of training. I only stopped working here because of the pandemic.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Call Center Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Guelph
Interview Descriptions: Very easy. They give you the script to practice, and you just need to be well prepared about the script. And you need to persuade them to donate according to the script.
Interview Questions: What is your availability

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Guelph (Guelph, ON) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: apply online with your resume and cover letter, whatever you feel is necessary. you can attach your letters of recommendation and any other certificates with your application. Hired based on your skills during your undergrad
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Guelph
Interview Descriptions: Smooth and clear, but it depends on the faculty you work with, as basically everything is determined by him/her. The hiring process depends on where you did your grad school.
Interview Questions: They asked about my PhD research and publications

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Guelph (Guelph, ON)
Interview Descriptions: For each course, the professor selected questions regarding the content and ask questions accordingly. They would send you an email before you are selected and ensure that you meet with them 1 on 1 to make sure that you are a good option for the job.
Interview Questions: Define a certain word (associated with the subject), or answer questions on how to apply the knowledge on the course.

title: Residence Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Guelph (University of Guelph, ON) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Circuit: 1. Panel Interview with a scenario about how you would handle a violent and/or serious situation regarding all residents; 2. Role Play with a current employee pretending to be a student who was too shy and felt home sick; 3. Two-on-One normal questioned interview.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself.
What skills do you possess?
Why would make a great fit?
What do you admire about the position/university?
How can you make a difference?
How familiar are you with residence guidelines?
What can you tell us about the University's missions?
What is your availability?

title: Stewardship Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Guelph (Guelph, ON)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was long and spanned over 3 months. Everyone was friendly and professional and overall left a good impression of the institution. I was required to give a brief presentation and several tests following the panel style interview in the first round, and was another panel interview for second rounds.
Interview Questions: Everything that was asked was situational based and asked me to "provide direct examples of a time when...." some of them included had a conflict with a colleague or manager and how did I resolve it. Be prepared to share lots of detailed stories, and in detail.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Guelph in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Brief, I had sent an email and had casual conversation before hand about doing a masters program. I worked three months with my supervisor before starting my masters program. My supervisor was very relaxed and open to my questions .
Interview Questions:
What kind of research project do you see your self working on?
Do you mind working in the hot greenhouse?
Can you lift heavy objects?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Guelph (Guelph, ON) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: The lab PI meet with me and I introduced my past research and showed my interests in his projects and He described the research projects his lab is doing and we both talked about our future visions.
Interview Questions: You seems to be over-qualified for this project, would you be get bored in the future?

title: Food Service Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Guelph (Guelph, ON)
Interview Descriptions: really brief, care more about how much you can work, be sure to have a good schedule. The employer was late but he was really friendly, honestly it was a really easy interview, didnt ask about  prior experience or anything
Interview Questions: how many hours can you work

title: TA Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Guelph (Guelph, ON)
Interview Descriptions: there is no interview, you apply through the internal website posting.  You will only get access to this website if you have an offer of admittance to the program of your choice, as well as an offer of sponsorship. this will be known to you before coming to the school.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Guelph (Guelph, ON) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview is typically easy.  Prepare your resume and cover letter well, show your experience, and most of committee will let you get approved. Interviewed was happened in a easy and less-tense environment. After interviewing, they will notify you quickly in one week
Interview Questions: How do you manage your time?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Guelph (Guelph, ON)
Interview Descriptions: good. apply through their website. The instructor will review and offer the job if you qualify. Only sometimes they call in for an interview. Be prepared in advance for every week
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Guelph (Guelph, ON)
Interview Descriptions: Apply online. The instructor will review our profile and appoint you if you meet the requirements. Be prepared in advance and always consider this position as a way to improve our knowledge
Interview Questions: N/A

title: PDF Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Guelph (Guelph, ON) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Apply and short listed. A techanical interview with presentation. One hour process ... panel asked a lot of questions related to my past experience and how they can help in solving the problem they have for the project.
Interview Questions: All technical

title: Laboratory Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Guelph (Guelph, ON) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions:
- Apply internally, tier-based system
- Depending on the section, the questions will be skewed one way
- Good luck if management does not favour you
- Ensure you have a M.Sc. and don't worry about experience because you just need to speak well.
Interview Questions: Explain any methods, apparatuses, or techniques related to chromatography.

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Guelph (University of Guelph, ON) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions:
3 parts: a group interview, a role play, and a 'formal' manager interview

for group: you have to come up with a solution to a problem (eg. hate activity in residence)
for role play: you had to pretend to be an RA and talk to a stressed student
for formal interview: normal one-on-one
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you had to deal with conflict

title: Analyst III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Guelph
Interview Descriptions: University assembles an Interview board for each position being hired for - minimal of 3 personnel. They will include an external member from the department that is hiring and will take turns asking questions.About 10 interview questions -  mostly behavioral. Often multi-step questions as well. Recommend - if they don't give you a hard-copy to refer to-  that you ask to repeat the question to make note of a all the content you need to answer. Find the interview rigorous but, if prepared with your own specific examples, you have opportunity to really highlight skills that you need to.
Interview Questions: This position requires competency in a wide range of technical skills such as application configuration and development; system integration; web interfaces; db admin; authentication management using LDAP; software as a service (SaaS). Tell us about the depth and breadth of your knowledge of technical skills. How did you acquire these skills and how have they been brought to use at previous jobs

title: Cafeteria Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Guelph (Guelph, ON) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Basically just had a chat about yourself , I didn't have past work experiences so it was to see how I would fit with the other workers, it helps to know someone that works there
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Guelph (Guelph, ON)
Interview Descriptions: It was a technical interview with PI only. He asked about my past experiences related to the proposed research and also outlined the research project and its objectives. He later took me around and showed the research facility and introduced to the other researchers.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my experience in molecular biology and protein purification techniques.

title: Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Guelph
Interview Descriptions:
2 main interviews. All the questions were very technical questions. Questions related to data structures, algorithms, and coding skills in different programming languages.

There were also question some questions related to how you would deal with certain scenarios like tight project deadline, or projects you do not have any previous experience in.
Interview Questions: Everything was fine

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Guelph (Guelph, ON) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Interview very informal and about 15minutes. Began with what the position is about and preferable what they want to get done. TOld me about the project and asked me to propose some idea to solve the problem. 

Came up with some stuff as well as hardware we could use and he gave me the job.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to become a research assitant

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Guelph (Guelph, ON) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: To begin, one had to apply via email or in person with URA applications. these applications were for students seeking summer employment. Then a formal interview was held. The experience was personal and quite nice. It was an enjoyable process.
Interview Questions: Tell me a little about yourself

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Guelph (Guelph, ON) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: I wrote an email to the professor and attached the application that was provided on the website along with my resume and cover letter (I believe the application looked for a statement of intent as well). I had a phone interview and then came in for an in-person interview. I had a class with the professor at the time and he also mentioned that he was really impressed with a paper that I wrote, which I believe helped me get the position, but overall, my experience was what quickly showed to be my greatest asset in the role.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your past experience gathering primary data.

title: Co-op Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Guelph (University of Guelph, ON) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the University's recruiting website. I was granted an interview within a few days along with approx. 6 other students. The interview was held in the lab where the job would take place. I met the professor that ran the lab, his lab manager, the post-doc I would be working closely with, and the student I would be replacing. I was able to see the lab and get to know the people I would be working with over coffee. The entire interview took about an hour and a half.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Guelph
Interview Descriptions: Resume and cover letter submitted, interview granted.
Interview Questions: When was a time you were presented with a difficult customer, and how did you respond?

title: Incoming Student Facilitator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Guelph
Interview Descriptions: Student Life is very into who you are as a person, as well as your past experiences (not necessarily work experiences). They ask behavioural questions, so be sure to pick examples that best reflect who you are and what you're about! Usually they give you the questions 5 minutes before the interview, so you can read them and be a bit more prepared for what they're going to ask.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you have worked with diversity.

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Guelph (Guelph, ON) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was very informal.  No committee, just one talk with the manager.  They seemed desperate for someone with experience.  I was a bit surprised but just went with the flow.  Questions were easy but seemed irrelevant. Did get a job offer and took the job, but the work environment turned out to be fairly unprofessional.
Interview Questions: Do you like to cook?

title: Technology Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Guelph (University of Guelph, ON) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: behavioural and situational interview. Panel alternated in asking questions and explaining the culture of the company and department. Approximate time for interview was 2 hours.  Explained Organizational chart and vision. I was very impressed with the process, and would be very excited to be offered the position with the University of Guelph
Interview Questions: What are your greatest/weakest strengths?

title: PhD Candidate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Guelph (Guelph, ON) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to give a presentation and they asked few questions based on what i presented. They were more interested to know if i am dedicated and passionate about research
Interview Questions: Why did you quit your last job and why do you want to do PhD?

title: Web Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Guelph (Guelph, ON) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions:
I was contact VIA phone then by email to come in for an interview.
I was interviewed by 4 people in the Communication department. We were lead to a small board room where we all sat at a table for the interview process. It was difficult to consistently make eye contact with everyone since they were sat all around me.

They asked me a series of questions that they had laid out on sheets of paper, and as I answered they took notes.

I also showed them additional pieces of my portfolio that were not showcased on my website.
Interview Questions: You are presented with a blank, white page in the internet browser.  Take us through the process of how you would troubleshoot this problem.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Guelph (Guelph, ON) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Submitted an application, standard 20 minute interview. Standard interview questions - tell me about yourself, strengths, weaknesses, what motivates you, where you see yourself in 5 years.  The job duties were discussed, salary and benefits were discussed. Go in there, be yourself and you will be fine.  No prior teaching experience required.
Interview Questions: Why did I want to teach the specific course
